meanings.definition: A measure of length equal to 45 inches.
meanings.sent1: She bought a beautiful fabric that was three ells long.
meanings.sent2: The tailor used two ells of cloth to make the dress.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled an endless stream of ells from his hat.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement stretched out like an ell, reaching far and wide.
meanings.sent5: The old map showed distances in ells, a unit of measurement long forgotten.

meanings.definition: A former measure of length varying in different countries, but usually about 45 inches.
meanings.sent1: In ancient times, people used ells to measure the length of cloth.
meanings.sent2: The tapestry was woven using traditional measurements in ells.
meanings.sent3: The museum displayed an ancient ruler marked with ells.
meanings.sent4: His stories were as long as an ell, filled with tales of the past.
meanings.sent5: The tailor's shop still used the old system of ells for precise measurements.

meanings.definition: A garment or piece of cloth measuring an ell in length.
meanings.sent1: She draped the elegant scarf, exactly one ell in length, around her neck.
meanings.sent2: The cloak was made from a single piece of fabric, an ell long.
meanings.sent3: The fashion designer proudly presented her collection of ells.
meanings.sent4: The dress flowed gracefully, its train trailing like an ell behind her.
meanings.sent5: The ancient robe was said to be woven from golden threads, measuring seven ells in length.
